newsitem.title: UK: Britain's Mowlam condemns N.Ireland violence.
newsitem.headline: Britain's Mowlam condemns N.Ireland violence.

text.p: Britain's Northern Ireland Secretary, Mo Mowlam, on Monday condemned "orchestrated violence" that swept through Irish nationalist communities in Northern Ireland overnight.
Mowlam told a news conference: "I understand the anger there in nationalist communities but nothing justified the orchestrated violence that we have seen in the last 24 hours."
Mowlam, in her first comments on the violence, called on the Protestant Orange Order to display "willingness and understanding" in the holding of parades.
"There can and should be no triumphalism," she said.

Mowlam backed a decision by police chiefs to allow an Orange Order parade along the Garvaghy Road area of Portadown on Sunday over the objections of Catholic residents. The decision sparked some of the worst violence in Northern Ireland for years.
